required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Safety and Ability of SG1002 to Overcome Deficits in Hydrogen Sulfide in Heart Failure Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Dose Escalation Study to Assess the Safety and Ability of SG1002 to Overcome Circulating Deficits in Hydrogen Sulfide Found in Heart Failure Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with heart failure are reported to have lower levels of hydrogen sulfide in their blood, even though sulfur is available naturally in the diet. Hydrogen sulfide is a molecule that has been shown to have a number of beneficial effects and thus the low levels may contribute to the disease. This trial is testing whether a medical food product of synthetic sulfur molecules, SG1002, can overcome this deficit in blood levels of hydrogen sulfide.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects with heart failure have been shown to have a deficit in circulating hydrogen sulfide levels, which, since sulfur is not readily bioavailable and is declining in food substances, cannot be treated adequately by diet alone. This deficit in circulating hydrogen sulfide is thought to lead to increases in oxidative stress and with this, associated problems that can contribute to heart failure. This is a study to evaluate the safety and ability of multiple doses of oral SG1002 in subjects with heart failure to reverse the deficits in circulating hydrogen sulfide. The primary objective is to assess the safety and the ability of multiple doses of twice daily administration of SG1002 compared with placebo to increase circulating levels of hydrogen sulfide. Initially, a dose escalation study will be carried out for 21 days in 4 normal subjects, randomized 3:1 active:placebo. Subjects will receive a 200 mg dose BID for 7 days and in no adverse events, escalate to 400 mg for 7 days then 800 mg for 7 days. Safety parameters will be assessed for each dose, along with pharmacokinetic analysis and markers of oxidative stress and heart failure. Following completion of the normal healthy subjects, 10 heart failure subjects will be randomized 4:1 active:placebo and tested as described above.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Following 7 days of treatment at each of three doses
primary_outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting Treatment Emergent Adverse Events at any time during the study period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing Changes in Peak Hydrogen Sulfide Levels in Heart Failure Subjects Following SG1002 Administration.
secondary_outcome.description: At the start of each dose, blood samples will be obtained and circulating hydrogen sulfide levels will be assessed over a 24 hour period to determine whether SG1002 can overcome the deficits reported in heart failure patients. Peak hydrogen sulfide levels were measured during the first 4 hours post-administration when maximum concentrations of hydrogen sulfide were reached.

other_outcome.measure: Assessing Potential Clinical Benefits of SG1002 Administration by Analyzing BNP Levels.
other_outcome.description: BNP levels were measured for the each subject prior to treatment and after 7 days on each treatment dose, thus representing a change in BNP over the 21 day treatment period. Increased BNP levels are associated with worsening heart failure.

arm_group.description: One normal healthy subject and two heart failure subjects will be randomized and given placebo throughout the trial period.
200 mg capsule of SG1002 (alpha sulfur/sodium sulfate)

intervention.description: 200 mg capsules will be administered BID for 7 days, then doubled to 2 capsules BID for 7 days and doubled again to 4 capsules BID for the final 7 days.
200 mg capsules containing placebo will be administered BID for 7 days, then doubled to 2 capsules BID for 7 days and doubled again to 4 capsules BID for the final 7 days.

group.title: Sugar Capsule
group.description: Two normal healthy subject and two heart failure subjects will be randomized and given placebo throughout the trial period.

group.title: SG1002
group.description: 200 mg capsule of SG1002 (alpha sulfur/sodium sulfate) SG1002: 200 mg capsules will be administered BID for 7 days, then doubled to 2 capsules BID for 7 days and doubled again to 4 capsules BID for the final 7 days to six normal healthy subjects and six heart failure subjects.

group.title: Sugar Capsule
group.description: Two normal healthy subject and two heart failure subjects will be randomized and given placebo throughout the trial period.

group.title: SG1002
group.description: 200 mg capsule of SG1002 (alpha sulfur/sodium sulfate) SG1002: 200 mg capsules will be administered BID for 7 days, then doubled to 2 capsules BID for 7 days and doubled again to 4 capsules BID for the final 7 days. Six normal healthy subject and six heart failure subjects will be randomized and given SG1002 throughout the trial period.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Condition
measure.description: Heart Failure subjects were classified as NYHA Class II (Mild symptoms, including mild shortness of breath and/or angina) and slight limitation during ordinary activity) or III (Moderate symptoms, including marked limitation in activity due to symptoms, even during less-than-ordinary activity, e.g. walking short distances.Comfortable only at rest.)

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events
outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting Treatment Emergent Adverse Events at any time during the study period.
outcome.time_frame: Following 7 days of treatment at each of three doses

group.title: Sugar Capsule
group.description: Two normal healthy subject and two heart failure subjects will be randomized and given placebo throughout the trial period.

group.title: SG1002
group.description: 200 mg capsule of SG1002 (alpha sulfur/sodium sulfate) SG1002: 200 mg capsules will be administered BID for 7 days, then doubled to 2 capsules BID for 7 days and doubled again to 4 capsules BID for the final 7 days. Six normal healthy subject and six heart failure subjects will be randomized and given SG1002 throughout the trial period.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Adverse Events
measure.description: The number of subjects reporting Treatment Emergent Adverse Events at any time during the study period.

class.title: Subjects with no Treatment Emergent Adverse Events

outcome.title: Assessing Changes in Peak Hydrogen Sulfide Levels in Heart Failure Subjects Following SG1002 Administration.
outcome.description: At the start of each dose, blood samples will be obtained and circulating hydrogen sulfide levels will be assessed over a 24 hour period to determine whether SG1002 can overcome the deficits reported in heart failure patients. Peak hydrogen sulfide levels were measured during the first 4 hours post-administration when maximum concentrations of hydrogen sulfide were reached.
outcome.population: Heart failure subject (n=6) had baseline levels of hydrogen sulfide recorded at 0, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 12 and 24 hours after the administration of the first dose of each of the escalating doses of SG1002.

group.title: Baseline
group.description: Baseline levels of free hydrogen sulfide (H2S) were recorded in heart failure subjects.

group.title: 200 mg SG1002
group.description: 200 mg capsules of SG1002 were administered BID for 7 days to heart failure subjects.

group.title: 400 mg SG002
group.description: 400 mg capsules of SG1002 were administered BID for 7 days to heart failure subjects.

group.title: 800 mg SG1002
group.description: 800 mg capsules of SG1002 were administered BID for 7 days to heart failure subjects.

measure.title: Assessing Changes in Peak Hydrogen Sulfide Levels in Heart Failure Subjects Following SG1002 Administration.
measure.description: At the start of each dose, blood samples will be obtained and circulating hydrogen sulfide levels will be assessed over a 24 hour period to determine whether SG1002 can overcome the deficits reported in heart failure patients. Peak hydrogen sulfide levels were measured during the first 4 hours post-administration when maximum concentrations of hydrogen sulfide were reached.
measure.population: Heart failure subject (n=6) had baseline levels of hydrogen sulfide recorded at 0, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 12 and 24 hours after the administration of the first dose of each of the escalating doses of SG1002.

outcome.title: Assessing Potential Clinical Benefits of SG1002 Administration by Analyzing BNP Levels.
outcome.description: BNP levels were measured for the each subject prior to treatment and after 7 days on each treatment dose, thus representing a change in BNP over the 21 day treatment period. Increased BNP levels are associated with worsening heart failure.
outcome.population: Levels of BNP were recorded at baseline and every 7 days in the placebo group or the SG1002 dose escalation group.

group.title: Sugar Capsule: Day 0
group.description: Baseline BNP levels of the subjects receiving sugar capsules.

group.title: Sugar Capsules: Day 7
group.description: Baseline BNP levels of the subjects receiving sugar capsules for 7 days.

group.title: Sugar Capsules: Day 14
group.description: Baseline BNP levels of the subjects receiving sugar capsules for 14 days.

group.title: Sugar Capsules: Day 21
group.description: Baseline BNP levels of the subjects receiving sugar capsules for 21 days.

group.title: SG1002: Day 0
group.description: Baseline BNP levels of the subjects who were randomized to the SG1002 treatment group, prior to any drug administration.

group.title: SG1002: Day 7
group.description: Baseline BNP levels of the subjects who were randomized to the SG1002 treatment group, following administration of 200 mg SG1002 BID for 7 days.

group.title: SG1002: Day 14
group.description: Baseline BNP levels of the subjects who were randomized to the SG1002 treatment group, following administration of 200 mg SG1002 BID for 7 days, then 400 mg SG1002 BID for an additional 7 days.

group.title: SG1002: Day 21
group.description: Baseline BNP levels of the subjects who were randomized to the SG1002 treatment group, following administration of 200 mg SG1002 BID for 7 days, then 400 mg SG1002 BID for an additional 7 days and then 800 mg SG1002 BID for an additional 7 days..

measure.title: Assessing Potential Clinical Benefits of SG1002 Administration by Analyzing BNP Levels.
measure.description: BNP levels were measured for the each subject prior to treatment and after 7 days on each treatment dose, thus representing a change in BNP over the 21 day treatment period. Increased BNP levels are associated with worsening heart failure.
measure.population: Levels of BNP were recorded at baseline and every 7 days in the placebo group or the SG1002 dose escalation group.

group.title: Sugar Capsule
group.description: Two normal healthy subject and two heart failure subjects will be randomized and given placebo throughout the trial period.

group.title: SG1002
group.description: 200 mg capsule of SG1002 (alpha sulfur/sodium sulfate) SG1002: 200 mg capsules will be administered BID for 7 days, then doubled to 2 capsules BID for 7 days and doubled again to 4 capsules BID for the final 7 days. Six normal healthy subject and six heart failure subjects will be randomized and given placebo throughout the trial period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Technical problems in measuring free H2S levels due to sample stability made assessment of PK difficult.
